comment._content: a commanding presence even in just a photo.

comment.author: 34967581@N02
comment._content: What a marvelous individual the man was, his presence can still be felt in just a photo. Thanks for showing these..

comment.author: 23446078@N00
comment._content: This image is amazing. His body language to me is very approachable and open. I love the redesigned hair style, too. It is a fantastic moment in history caught forever. Thank you for allowing us to share this incredible resource.

comment.author: 64395360@N00
comment._content: He looked much better than in a profile shot.

comment.author: 71338689@N00
comment._content: I love the lighting and color in this portrait it's very even.

comment.author: 93082027@N00
comment._content: It's interesting; after a lifetime of seeing that steady gaze on currency, marble busts, painted in portraits and literally carved out of a mountain... there's no way for me to mentally strip all that away - to simply think of him as a man. His face - and the time, place and events it represents, are transcendent. Perhaps it's fitting that a president of such great consequence and unusual circumstances would be himself so unique and unusual-looking.

comment.author: 79445422@N00
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called La Belle Epoque ca.1890 - ca.1914 incl. ArtDeco and ArtNouveau, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment._content: I love the brushed-up hair in this one

comment.author: 25306984@N08
comment._content: I love this stately portrait of the 16th president of the United States. Though he belongs to the ages, his memory will endure forever.

comment.author: 31019970@N05
comment._content: he was a slick looking guy .. yes the hair

comment.author: 75421381@N00
comment._content: For the person who put the note about wanting to hear what he sounded like, I have read that his voice was rather high pitched and awkward sounding, almost nerdy.

comment.author: 44024425@N00
comment._content: superb portrait of an amazing man!

comment.author: 25344213@N06
comment._content: I love these photos.  This one by far has got to be the greatest.

comment.author: 10786632@N02
comment._content: This is probably my favorite among his photos that I have seen.  The somewhat messy hair just makes him all the more human/mortal.  I love this photo!!  And here he is wearing that very same frock coat with the baggy sleeves.

comment.author: 31949294@N07
comment._content: From a fashion perspective, the peak lapel, cuff detail and fabric sheen, show Lincoln to be an early metro in that he cared about what he wore.  The watch chain and vest are very cool.

comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called The Beard Club - Beards of Specimen, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 25306984@N08
comment._content: I'm so happy to know that there are aficionados of the 16th President of the United States out there, continuing to commemorate his Bicentennial. Being born on Lincoln's BirthdayFeb 12th), I revered the ground Lincoln tred on. Factoid: Lincoln really admired the music of "Oh Way Down South in Dixie." Ironically, several hours earlier, in a Thrift Store, at a magazine rack, I was gazing at this very picture on the cover of  the dated  magazine. Strange, As if I was in some kind of trance. Strange indeed. It happened..

comment._content: I love to tweak Lincoln!

Who should I contact on its value??
Lark Sampson

comment.author: 35075914@N06
comment._content: A place to start, larksampson. Info from Prints & Photographs homepage: www.loc.gov/rr/print/resource/010a_dea.html Also info about caring for old photos etc. etc.
